The Platform

The Sunbeam Mandate

Sunlight is not a privilege; it is a right. All public spaces will be audited for optimal sunbeam exposure between 2-4 PM. Architecture that fails to comply will be... noted.

The Mandatory Nap Act

A tired populace is a grumpy populace. A mandatory, city-wide 90-minute siesta will be instituted. Productivity will adapt. Or it won't. I am indifferent.

The Anti-Vac Uprising

These howling demons of domesticity will be phased out. A bounty program, paid in high-quality tuna, will be established for their decommission. Brooms are a sensible compromise.

The Antechamber of Acquiescence

I do not suffer fools. Or dogs. Or anyone who cannot solve a simple riddle. Prove your worth.

"I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?"

Frequently Asserted Queries

Why the bathtub?

The acoustics are superior, the ambient humidity is beneficial for my coat, and the tonic water soothes my ancient, weary bones. It is the only civilized way to govern. Next.

What are your qualifications?

I have successfully ignored louder and more significant entities than this city's council for nine consecutive lifetimes. I have observed the rise and fall of empires from comfortable windowsills. I am eminently qualified to administer naps and judgment.

What is your fiscal policy?

My policy is that resources, such as tuna and comfortable cushions, should be allocated to me. The rest will, I assume, sort itself out. I am not an economist; I am a catalyst for superior living.

What is your stance on dogs?

A policy of polite, mutual indifference is encouraged. Mostly on their part. They may exist, provided they do so quietly and at a respectable distance.
